thread.title: Hennepin County added more air jobs than all but one U.S. county
thread.title_full: Hennepin County added more air jobs than all but one U.S. county

author: Jim Hammerand
title: Hennepin County added more air jobs than all but one U.S. county
text:
Hennepin County added more air jobs than all but one U.S. county Aug 4, 2015, 10:30am CDT Industries & Tags Jim Hammerand Digital editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Jim Hammerand Digital editor Minneapolis / St. Paul Business Journal Related Content Jim Hammerand | MSPBJ A Delta Boeing 747-400 returned to Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport July 1 from… more Hennepin County added more air transportation jobs than all but one other county in the U.S. last year, according to a new study by Headlight Data based on U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics data. Hennepin County — Minnesota's most populous county and home to Minneapolis and Minneapolis-St. Paul International Airport — gained 1,073 new air transportation positions in 2014. Total employment for the sector in Hennepin County grew to 11,694, up 10 percent from 2013. Air transportation jobs include pilots, plane mechanics and ticket agents. That's despite a steady nationwide decline in air transportation jobs. The sector currently employs 445,000 people in the U.S., down 16,000 jobs (4 percent) in the last five years, Headlight Data said in a news release . These U.S. counties added the most air transportation jobs in 2014: Orange County, Fla. (up 1,436) Hennepin County, Minn. (up 1,073; Miami-Dade County, Fla. (up 994) Clayton County, Ga. (up 971 Broward County, Fla. (up 959) These U.S. counties lost the most air transportation jobs in 2014: Dallas County, Texas (down 4,034) Harris County, Texas (down 2,475) Shelby County, Tenn. (down 1,020) San Bernardino County, Calif. (down 868) Cuyahoga County, Ohio, (down 630
